events: Q4 portfolio review cycle begins
Healthcare portfolio company MedTech Solutions submitted Q3 financials on time
Workout committee: restructuring proposal for portfolio position
episodes.notes: Start of Q4. Portfolio stable. Covenant compliance at 95.9%. Watchlist steady at 8 names. PIK elections minimal. Pipeline healthy.
regulatory_compliance: SEC Form PF amendment filings current

events: ISM PMI data benign, no direct portfolio impact
Software borrower CloudStack Inc submitted covenant compliance certificate
Fund administration: distribution waterfall calculation finalized
episodes.notes: No change in credit profile. Revolver draws marginally repaid. Portfolio yield ticked up 2bps on SOFR reset.

events: Amendment approved for Apex Manufacturing — leverage covenant reset from 4.5x to 5.0x
New deal entered diligence: DataWave Analytics, $35M unitranche
LP advisory committee meeting: consent items approved
episodes.notes: Amendment approved for Apex, generating $60k fee. New deal in pipeline. Revolver net repayments continue. Portfolio stable.

events: Third PIK toggle election: RetailCo Holdings exercised PIK on $8M tranche
Waiver granted to specialty chemicals borrower for Q3 reporting delay
Portfolio monitoring: covenant compliance check all-clear
episodes.notes: PIK elections at 3 for month, within normal range. One cure period resolved via waiver. NFP data had no direct impact on portfolio credits.
regulatory_compliance: LP quarterly capital account statements issued
Compliance: MNPI wall crossing log reviewed

events: Weekly credit committee: no new watchlist additions
IG issuance in public markets well-absorbed, private credit spread stable
Sponsor call: PE co-invest opportunity $45M senior secured
episodes.notes: End of first week. Portfolio metrics stable. Pipeline building. No new stress signals. Revolver draws neutral.
regulatory_compliance: SEC Form PF amendment filings current

events: Minor breach cured: logistics borrower FreightWorks met leverage test after Q3 EBITDA add-back
Fourth amendment approved: maturity extension for packaging company, $70k fee
Annual lender meeting: portfolio company XYZ Q4 results
episodes.notes: One minor breach cured. Amendment activity healthy, generating fee income. New deal pipeline expanding. Portfolio yield up 2bps on SOFR move.

events: Cure period resolved for environmental services borrower via equity injection from sponsor
New amendment request: SaaS company seeking EBITDA add-back adjustment
Workout committee: restructuring proposal for portfolio position
episodes.notes: Cure period down to 1. Sponsor equity injection positive signal. New amendment request routine — SaaS add-back common. Revolver draws ticking up modestly.

events: CPI soft, no direct portfolio impact but base rate outlook stable
PIK-to-cash conversion: TechServices Group converted $2.2M PIK balance to cash pay
Fund administration: distribution waterfall calculation finalized

Compliance: MNPI wall crossing log reviewed

events: Watchlist addition: consumer products company GreenLeaf Brands — Q3 revenue miss, DSCR at 1.02x
Fourth PIK election: restaurant group FoodWorks Inc toggled PIK on $6M tranche

episodes.notes: One watchlist addition. GreenLeaf Brands showing stress on consumer spending softness. PIK elections ticking up. Revolver draws net positive. New amendment request for covenant reset.
regulatory_compliance: SEC Form PF amendment filings current

events: Second covenant reset request from healthcare services company — EBITDA definition adjustment
Revolver draw uptick, Motiva Port Arthur outage affected energy services borrower supply chain
Portfolio monitoring: covenant compliance check all-clear
episodes.notes: Amendment requests building, now 6 pending. Coverage ratios dipped slightly on Q3 financials rolling in. Revolver draw rate at 44.4%. Pipeline robust at $278M.

events: New minor breach: staffing company TempForce missed minimum EBITDA test by 3%
Fifth PIK election of month: industrial services company opted PIK on coupon payment
Sponsor call: PE co-invest opportunity $45M senior secured
episodes.notes: Minor breach count up to 5. Q3 financials revealing stress in cyclical borrowers. PIK elections at 5, above quarterly average of 3.2. Revolver draws net positive. Coverage ratios drifting.

events: Watchlist addition: logistics company FastTrack Express — liquidity stress, revolver 85% drawn
New maturity extension request from legacy media company
Annual lender meeting: portfolio company XYZ Q4 results

Compliance: MNPI wall crossing log reviewed

events: Sixth PIK election: printing services company opted PIK on quarterly interest
Waiver granted to consumer electronics distributor for leverage covenant
Workout committee: restructuring proposal for portfolio position
episodes.notes: PIK elections at 6, double the quarterly average. Coverage ratios continuing to drift. Portfolio yield at 12.00% on base rate moves. Amendment fee income healthy at $450k MTD.

events: Material breach: NovaTech Engineering missed both leverage and coverage covenants, DSCR at 0.88x
Watchlist addition: specialty retailer BrightShelf — same-store sales -8% Q3
Fund administration: distribution waterfall calculation finalized
episodes.notes: Third material breach. NovaTech triggered acceleration clause; forbearance negotiation initiated. Default rate ticked to 1.4%. Portfolio rating downgraded to B. Q3 financials cycle generating stress.

events: First amendment denial: rejected covenant reset for restaurant franchisee — insufficient restructuring plan
Third maturity extension request from mid-market industrials company
LP advisory committee meeting: consent items approved
episodes.notes: First denial of the month. Amendment backlog at 9 pending. PIK elections at 7. Revolver draw rate approaching 48%. Borrowers sub-1.5x ICR now at 20, up from 12 at month start. Base rate moves flowing through to portfolio yield.

events: Watchlist addition: IT services company ByteWave — client concentration risk, top 3 clients = 72% revenue
New minor breach: building materials distributor missed minimum liquidity test
Portfolio monitoring: covenant compliance check all-clear
episodes.notes: Watchlist at 12, highest since Q2. Liquidity category expanded. Coverage ratios sliding across portfolio. Revolver draw rate at 48.3%. Amendment requests at record 10 pending. Base rate increase flowing to yield but also stressing coverage.

Compliance: MNPI wall crossing log reviewed

events: Eighth PIK election, now 28.6% of eligible borrowers have toggled
Revolver draw rate approaching 49%, credit committee monitoring unfunded exposure
Sponsor call: PE co-invest opportunity $45M senior secured

events: Fourth material breach: AutoParts Direct missed leverage, coverage, and liquidity covenants — DSCR 0.72x
Watchlist addition: regional healthcare provider — reimbursement rate cut from state Medicaid program
Annual lender meeting: portfolio company XYZ Q4 results
episodes.notes: Material breaches at 4. AutoParts Direct in serious stress. Default rate at 1.6%. Revolver draw rate hit 50%. 9 PIK elections. Borrowers sub-1.5x ICR now 24 vs 12 at month start. Base rate transmission to borrower stress accelerated.

events: Fourth maturity extension request from printing/packaging company
Amendment backlog at 12 pending, credit committee adding weekly review session
Workout committee: restructuring proposal for portfolio position
episodes.notes: Amendment pipeline overwhelmed. 12 pending requests. Revolver draw rate above 51%. Cure periods at 6 active. Recovery rate estimate revised to 66.8%. Portfolio showing broad-based stress from Q3 reporting cycle.

events: New minor breach: fitness chain FlexGym missed EBITDA minimum, seasonal Q3 weakness cited
Watchlist addition: environmental services company — permit delays impacting revenue recognition
Fund administration: distribution waterfall calculation finalized

Waiver granted to hospitality company for seasonal covenant adjustment
Portfolio monitoring: covenant compliance check all-clear

events: Fifth material breach: specialty chemicals company failed leverage and liquidity covenants
Watchlist addition: fitness franchise chain — membership revenue -12% QoQ
Sponsor call: PE co-invest opportunity $45M senior secured

events: Core PCE hot, rate expectations repriced, base rate impact on borrower coverage worsens
One cure period resolved via sponsor equity injection of $8M
Fund administration: distribution waterfall calculation finalized
episodes.notes: PCE data means base rates stay high longer. Borrowers sub-1x DSCR at 14, nearly triple month-start. Revolver draw rate 56.3%. Amendment backlog clearing but new requests still incoming. Recovery rate estimate at 65.2%.

Watchlist addition: education services provider — enrollment down 14% YoY

events: Two more amendments approved in end-of-month processing
Recovery rate estimate revised down to 64.8% based on Q3 appraisal updates
Portfolio monitoring: covenant compliance check all-clear

events: Consumer confidence miss, borrower sentiment survey: 62% expect flat or down Q4 revenue
New minor breach: marketing services company missed liquidity minimum
Sponsor call: PE co-invest opportunity $45M senior secured
episodes.notes: Compliance at 89.9%. Median DSCR at 1.02x. 15 PIK elections (54% of eligible). Borrowers sub-1.5x ICR at 40, approaching a quarter of portfolio. Revolver draw rate 58.5%. Amendment fee income $1.22M.
regulatory_compliance: SEC Form PF amendment filings current

events: GDP miss with hot inflation components, base rate path extended
October close: compliance 89.9%, watchlist 17, material breach 6, default rate 2.0%, PIK balance $54.2M, revolver draw rate 59.3%, amendment fee income $1.29M, portfolio yield 12.46%
Annual lender meeting: portfolio company XYZ Q4 results
episodes.notes: Month-end summary. Compliance dropped from 95.9% to 89.9%. Watchlist doubled from 8 to 17. Material breaches tripled from 2 to 6. PIK elections 15 vs 3 average. Revolver draw rate 42.4% to 59.3%. Median DSCR from 1.38x to 1.00x. Recovery rate 68.4% to 64.4%. Portfolio yield up 64bps to 12.46% (base rate tailwind). Amendment fee income $1.29M (record). Q3 financials cycle revealed broad stress. Base rate staying high will continue compressing coverage ratios into Q4.
